data.title: Who is The War and Treaty? Husband and wife music duo
data.meta_description: url: who-war-and-treaty-musicWho are the members of The War and Treaty?How long have they been married?Do they have any kids?
data.text:
THE singing-songwriting duo have been releasing music since 2016, but they've shot to fame in 2023 thanks to their major label debut album.

The War and Treaty's music mixes all types of different genres, but they're breaking barriers in the country music scene.

Who are the members of The War and Treaty?

The War and Treaty consists of the husband-and-wife duo Michael Trotter Jr. and Tanya Trotter.

Tanya Trotter is an American musician, actress, and author from Washington D.C.

She grew up singing in choirs at her Baptist church services and while attending Catholic school.

She was also a choir member at Morgan State University in Baltimore, Maryland, where she majored in psychology.

Tanya's first big break was her role as Tanya in Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit.

She starred as a choir member alongside Whoopi Goldberg, Lauryn Hill, Sheryl Lee Ralph, and Jennifer Love Hewitt.

In 1994, she released her debut album, Natural Thing, which hit the 58th spot on the US R&B/Hip Hop Albums chart.

In 1995, Tanya received a nomination for Best New Artist at the Soul Train Awards.

She signed with Sean Combs' Bad Boy Entertainment in 1996 but was released from her contract in the early 2000s.

Before starting The War and Treaty in 2014, she was involved in musical theater productions.

Her songs were also featured in hit Hollywood movies, including Tyler Perry's 2008 film The Family That Preys.

Michael Trotter Jr. also began singing long before the duo started, beginning his musical career during a stint in Iraq in 2004.

He taught himself how to play piano on a confiscated keyboard, and sang songs at memorial services held for fallen soldiers.

Michael won Military Idol, the US Army's version of the hit singing competition, American Idol, during a competition in Germany.

When he was discharged from the military, he met Tanya, and the rest was history – musically and romantically.

The two founded The War and Treaty in Michigan in 2014.

Since then, they've headlined shows and opened for a diverse group of artists, including Al Green, Brandi Carlile, John Legend, and Van Morrison.

In 2016, they released their duet album, Love Affair, under the name Trotter & Blount.

By 2017, they released Down to the River, an EP described as a mixture of blues, country, soul, bluegrass, and gospel genres.

In 2018, their debut album, Healing Tide, garnered critical acclaim, with Rolling Stone comparing the duo's sound to Tina and Ike Turner.

Their second studio album, Hearts Town, came out in 2020.

In May 2022, they signed a major label deal with Universal Music Group Nashville.

The War and Treaty released their major label debut album, Lover's Game, on March 10, 2023.

In 2023, they also became the first black duo to be nominated for the Country Music Association Award and the Academy of Country Music Award for Duo of the Year.

In August 2023, their collaboration with country star Zach Bryan, the song Hey Driver, peaked at #14 on the Billboard Hot 100.

The War and Treaty are also up for two Grammys at the 66th Annual Grammy Awards, scheduled for February 4, 2024.

They're nominated for Best New Artist, and Best American Roots Song for their hit single, Blank Page.

The duo may have started as an indie collaborative, but with 5.5 million monthly listeners on Spotify, they've proven they're destined for stardom.

How long have they been married?

Michael and Tanya have to be on the same page when it comes to their musical collaborations, but the duo aren't aligned when it comes to how they met.

Tanya claims the duo met at a festival in Maryland in the early 2010s, where she was volunteering and Michael was performing.

Michael says he noticed Tanya on the big screen in the 90s, in the hit movie Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit.

He reportedly told his parents "That's my wife right there."

In an interview with NPR Music, Tanya recalls: "His personality drew me in initially and then the sparks started to fly."

She added: "I knew that I was hooked."

Within years, the duo fell in love, but not before "playing the back-and-forth game of love," depicted in their single and album, Lover's Game.

In a 2022 interview with People, Tanya said: "We did play all those games."

"Michael actually threw my phone number away. I really had to call around trying to figure out his phone number."

The duo ended up tying the knot in 2014, but it hasn't been smooth sailing ever since.

On The War and Treaty website, Tanya writes: “When you look at a married couple like Michael and I, people see the happiness and they see us on stage. They see the love."

She adds: “But they don’t understand that we’re just like any other couple. We have our ups and downs.”

Despite their ups and downs, the musical and romantic duo prove they've got the talent, strength, and love to take the music industry by storm.

Do they have any kids?

Michael Trotter Jr. and his wife, Tanya Trotter, don't just blend musical genres – they also have a blended family.

The couple are parents to four children.

They have two girls and two boys.

Tanya had her first child, a son when she was 19.

He is now in his late 20s, with a degree in finance, and an affinity for health and fitness.

Michael also has two daughters from a previous marriage.

In an interview with Black and Married with Kids, Tanya describes Michael as a great dad and partner: "He’s an incredible father, he’s [also a] loving, patient, sensitive husband."

The duo also share a son, Legend, born in 2011.

Their son, now a teenager, is also musically inclined, going so far as to give his famous parents some pointers.
